ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Empty order.xml file when creating profiles and jobs in 1.14	and 1.12.1
ygData.msgSnippet: The no root element alerts suggests something wrong with the XML processing, and if you re using the Ubuntu-bundled gcj, I d try Sun s Java as the first

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Empty order.xml file when creating profiles
 and jobs in 1.14	and 1.12.1
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=IQp-Mo5_S1OxlouaC8rC_gPpsyjfQ76CtSqgYo3BeRVS

The 'no root element' alerts suggests something wrong with the XML 
processing, and if you're using the Ubuntu-bundled gcj, I'd try Sun's 
Java as the first step.

AFAIK, Heritrix has always had problems running on gcj, and we've never 
tried to get it working or tested it there. I know it's improved a lot, 
so it might work someday or with some extra effort -- but also, Sun's 
Java seems on the path to being fully GPL'd, so may become the default 
in Linux distros soon.

- Gordon @ IA

Gordon Paynter wrote:
> Hi all:
> 
> I have just installed version 1.14 (the first install I have done since 1.5!). I have found that when I create a new profile through the web UI, the order.xml file created is empty.  This carries over to jobs created using that profile: they have an empty order.xml file too. Obviously, these jobs don't work. 
> 
> I have also tried Heritrix 1.12.1 and I see the same behaviour, so presumably the problem is at my end. I have listed the Alerts I get below. 
> 
> 
> Here are a few more details:
> 
> When I create the profile in the web UI, I edit it and change the User-Agent and From header fields.  If I go back and edit it again in the web UI, my changes are still there, even though the order.xml file in the profile directory is zero bytes. If I stop Heritrix and restart, my changes are gone in the web UI too (suggests these values are cached?). 
> 
> If I add seeds to the profile, the seeds.xml file is saved correctly in the profile directory (and used in any job) alongside the empty order.xml file.
> 
> 
> Looking back in the mailing list, I see Sonja Schaule reported the same problem on 12/12/07 but got no response.
> 
> Also looking back on the mailing list I think someone else (Eric Hetzner?) stating that the Java packaged with Ubuntu/Debian was "not worth bothering with". Could this be the problem?  And why--a crazy Debian security measure?
> 
> TIA.
> Gordon
> 
> 
> When creating the profile I get alerts like this:
> 
> Time:   	 Mar. 28, 2008 02:20:04 GMT
> Level:  	WARNING
> Message:  	
> no root element: U+ffffffff in 'file:///home/paynter/Heritrix/heritrix-1.12.1/conf/profiles/single-site/order.xml', line: 1, column: 1
> Exception:  	
> No associated exception.
> 
> When I create a job based on the profile it also has an empty order.xml file, so I get alerts like these:
> 
> Time:   	 Mar. 28, 2008 02:34:29 GMT
> Level:  	WARNING
> Message:  	
> no root element: U+ffffffff in 'file:///home/paynter/Heritrix/heritrix-1.12.1/jobs/doomed-to-failure-20080328023407300/order.xml', line: 1, column: 1
> Exception:  	
> No associated exception.
> 
> Time:   	 Mar. 28, 2008 02:34:29 GMT
> Level:  	SEVERE
> Message:  	
> On crawl: doomed-to-failure You must set the User-Agent and From HTTP header values to acceptable strings. 
>  User-Agent: [software-name](+[info-url])[misc]
>  From: [email-address]
> Exception:  	
> org.archive.crawler.framework.exceptions.FatalConfigurationException: unacceptable user-agent  or from (Reedit your order file).
> Stacktrace: org.archive.crawler.framework.exceptions.FatalConfigurationException: unacceptable user-agent  or from (Reedit your order file).
>    at org.archive.crawler.datamodel.CrawlOrder.checkUserAgentAndFrom(CrawlOrder.java:436)
>    at org.archive.crawler.framework.CrawlController.initialize(CrawlController.java:335)
>    at org.archive.crawler.admin.CrawlJob.setupForCrawlStart(CrawlJob.java:846)
>    at org.archive.crawler.admin.CrawlJobHandler.startNextJobInternal(CrawlJobHandler.java:1142)
>    at org.archive.crawler.admin.CrawlJobHandler.startNextJobInternal(CrawlJobHandler.java:1152)
>    at org.archive.crawler.admin.CrawlJobHandler$3.run(CrawlJobHandler.java:1125)
>    at java.lang.Thread.run(libgcj.so.81)
> 
> 
> 
> Please consider our environment...  do you really need to print this email?
